results.title: Role of metformin in male oxidative stress infertility (MOSI): An in vitro experimental study.
results.text_hl: Role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Male</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007248 @@@male oxidative stress infertility@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Male</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007248 @@@MOSI@@@): An in vitro experimental study.

citations.NLM: Farooqui N, Khan S, Zahid N, Nazim SM, Tahir M, Rehman R. Role of metformin in male oxidative stress infertility (MOSI): An in vitro experimental study. Pak J Pharm Sci. 2024 May;37(3):663-667. PMID: 39340857

results.title: Protective effect of antidiabetic drugs against male infertility: evidence from Mendelian randomization.
results.text_hl: In SMR analysis, antidiabetic drugs targeting the genes @GENE_CPE @GENE_1363 @@@CPE@@@ (P = 0.03, HEIDI = 0.970) and @GENE_TRPM4 @GENE_54795 @@@TRPM4@@@ (P = 0.028, HEIDI = 0.746) were found to significantly reduce the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Male</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007248 @@@MIF@@@. CONCLUSION: Our study indicates that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, SGLT2i, @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ and its analogs, as well as @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulfonylureas@@@, may offer potential therapeutic benefits for @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Male</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007248 @@@MIF@@@.

citations.NLM: Li Y, Zhou T, Liu Z, Zhu X, Wu Q, Meng C, Deng Q. Protective effect of antidiabetic drugs against male infertility: evidence from Mendelian randomization. Diabetol Metab Syndr. 2025 Apr 28;17(1):140. PMID: 40296064
citations.BibTeX: @article{40296064, title={Protective effect of antidiabetic drugs against male infertility: evidence from Mendelian randomization.}, author={Li Y and Zhou T and Liu Z and Zhu X and Wu Q and Meng C and Deng Q}, journal={Diabetol Metab Syndr}, volume={17}, number={1}, pages={140}}

results.title: Autophagy: a multifaceted player in the fate of sperm
results.text_hl: We also performed a bibliographic search for the clinical impact of the autophagy process using the keywords of autophagy inhibitors such as '@CHEMICAL_bafilomycin_A1 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C040929 @@@bafilomycin A1@@@', '@CHEMICAL_Chloroquine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002738 @@@chloroquine@@@', '@CHEMICAL_Hydroxychloroquine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006886 @@@hydroxychloroquine@@@', '@CHEMICAL_3_methyladenine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C025946 @@@3-Methyl Adenine@@@ (3-MA)', '@CHEMICAL_Lucanthone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008154 @@@lucanthone@@@', '@CHEMICAL_Wortmannin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077191 @@@wortmannin@@@' and autophagy activators such as '@CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@rapamycin@@@', '@CHEMICAL_perifosine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C105905 @@@perifosine@@@', '@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@' in combination with 'disease', 'treatment', 'therapy', '@<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Male</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007248 @@@male infertility@@@' and equivalent terms.

citations.NLM: Wang M, Zeng L, Su P, Ma L, Zhang M, Zhang YZ. Autophagy: a multifaceted player in the fate of sperm Hum Reprod Update. 2022 Feb 28;28(2):200-231. PMID: 34967891

results.title: Metformin Improves Fertility in Obese Males by Alleviating Oxidative Stress-Induced Blood-Testis Barrier Damage
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@Obesity@@@, which is related to increased oxidative stress in various tissues, is a risk factor for @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Male</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007248 @@@male infertility@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is reported to have an antioxidant effect; however, the precise role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Infertility_Male</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007248 @@@male infertility@@@ remains unknown.

citations.NLM: Ye J, Luo D, Xu X, Sun M, Su X, Tian Z, Zhang M, Yu C, Guan Q. Metformin Improves Fertility in Obese Males by Alleviating Oxidative Stress-Induced Blood-Testis Barrier Damage Oxid Med Cell Longev. 2019;2019():9151067. PMID: 31583050
